organization.fullName: Henan University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

identificationModule.briefTitle: Exhaled Breath Condensate Biomarkers in CARAS
identificationModule.officialTitle: Preliminary Application and Evaluation of Exhaled Breath Condensate Biomarkers in Combined Allergic Rhinitis and Asthma Syndrome (CARAS)

leadSponsor.name: Henan University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To explore the differences in the expression of biomarkers in different sample types between the healthy population and different subgroups of the disease, and to screen for potential biomarkers in a more simple, direct and objective way. To screen the biomarkers that can be identified by CARAS Chinese medicine symptoms and different stages, and to provide a reference basis for individualised diagnosis and treatment of the disease.

conditions: Combined Allergic Rhinitis and Asthma Syndrome

armGroups.label: acute exacerbation CARAS
armGroups.description: Thirty subjects were included. No intervention was performed and only relevant patient information, blood and exhaled breath condensate were collected.

armGroups.label: chronic persistence CARAS
armGroups.description: Thirty subjects were included. No intervention was performed and only relevant patient information, blood and exhaled breath condensate were collected.

armGroups.description: Thirty subjects were included. No intervention was performed and only relevant patient information, blood and exhaled breath condensate were collected.

primaryOutcomes.description: Airway inflammation will be assessed using the IL-2、4、5、13.
Airway inflammation will be assessed using the IFN-γ.
Airway inflammation will be assessed using the TNF-β.
Airway inflammation will be assessed using the ECP.
Airway inflammation will be assessed using the IgE.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Higher FeNO values indicate higher airway inflammation.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Lung function will be assessed using the FEV1.
Lung function will be assessed using the FEV1.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: FVC as the percentage of the predicted value (FVC%)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Lung function will be assessed using the FVC%.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Forced expiratory volume in one second / forced vital capacity (FEV1/FVC)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Lung function will be assessed using the FEV1/FVC.

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Allergic rhinitis (AR) is a common chronic inflammatory disease of the upper respiratory tract with paroxysmal sneezing, nasal congestion, watery nasal discharge and nasal itching as the main clinical symptoms. Bronchial asthma (BA) is a complex heterogeneous chronic inflammatory disease of the bronchi with recurrent symptoms of wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, and coughing.AR usually coexists with BA, and about 70-90% of patients with asthma develop rhinitis, and about 40% of patients with rhinitis develop asthma. When AR and BA occur together, it is called combined allergic rhinitis and asthma syndrome (CARAS).

locations.facility: The First Affiliated Hospital of Henan University of Chinese Medicine
